PentestAgent is an AI-powered framework designed for automated black-box security testing. It supports various penetration testing workflows, including bug bounty hunting and red-teaming, by leveraging AI agents to interact with systems and identify vulnerabilities.

Trafexia is a desktop application built with Electron, Vue 3, and TypeScript that functions as a MITM proxy server. It allows users to intercept, analyze, and debug HTTP/HTTPS traffic from mobile devices, offering features like auto CA certificate generation, real-time capture, advanced filtering, and various export options.

NeoHtop is a modern, cross-platform system monitoring application built with Rust, Tauri, and Svelte. It provides real-time insights into CPU, memory usage, and running processes, offering advanced features like process search, filtering, and management.

This repository provides Python inference code for the Oasis 500M model, an interactive world model based on diffusion transformers. It allows users to generate gameplay frames autoregressively, conditioned on user keyboard input and a prompt frame from a video.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

AutoRLAIF is a Python framework that automates the fine-tuning of large language models using Reinforcement Learning from AI Feedback (RLAIF). It leverages techniques like QLoRA and PEFT for efficient training and integrates multiple datasets to improve model performance with minimal human supervision.
